panels.description: User licenses in Salesforce define the baseline level of features and permissions that a user can access within the Salesforce environment, determining what apps, objects, and functionalities are available to them based on their assigned license type.
panels.title: User Licenses Usage %

panels.description: Active Licenses details
panels.title: User Active Licenses Count (Used vs Total vs Percentage Utilized)

panels.description: Usage-based entitlements licenses in Salesforce are licenses that track and limit the consumption of specific features or services based on usage metrics, such as API calls or storage, rather than per-user allocations.
panels.title: Usage based entitlements Usage %

panels.description: Usage based entitlements Licenses details
panels.title: Usage based entitlements Licenses Count(Used vs Total)

panels.description: Licenses to grants access to additional features or permissions beyond the standard Salesforce license. It allows administrators to assign specific sets of permissions to users on top of their existing user license, enabling more granular control over feature access and customization.
panels.title: Permission Set License Usage %

panels.description: Permissionset Active Licenses details
panels.title: Permissionset Licenses Count (Used vs Total)
